title: Understanding the Nernst Equation
text: The Nernst equation is a fundamental equation in electrochemistry that relates the cell potential to the concentrations of the reactants and products involved in the redox reaction. It helps in predicting the direction of the reaction and the equilibrium position.

title: Components of the Nernst Equation
text: The Nernst equation includes the standard cell potential, the reaction quotient, and the number of moles of electrons transferred in the reaction. It is used to calculate the cell potential under non-standard conditions.

hintAnswer: The cell potential to the activities or concentrations of oxidized and reduced species.
title: Identifying the Correct Relationship
text: Which of the following best describes what the Nernst equation relates?
choices: The cell potential to temperature only.
The cell potential to the activities or concentrations of oxidized and reduced species.
The solubility of a salt to ionic strength.
The pH of a solution to its temperature.
